example.text: Threatening to throw our economy into chaos, as House Republicans are doing, should not be part of good faith negotiations on the debt ceiling. Nor should the long list of draconian cuts that Republicans demand we make before they will agree to pay our country’s bills.

Several of my colleagues and I recently sent a letter to the Department of Education urging them to work with school districts to combat the opioid crisis and substance misuse in schools. Together, we can end the opioid crisis. [[url]]

If you’re booking a flight, it should simple to identify and compare amenities and compensation policies between airlines. Thanks to the Biden-Harris Administration, consumers will be able to easily view this information all on one site. [[url]]

Mr. Speaker, I thank the ranking member for yielding time. Mr. Speaker, I rise in strong opposition to this so-called Schools Not Shelters Act, which should be called the shutting out students act to reflect what this cruel legislation actually does.

Thank you to Laurel Porter at [[user]] for the opportunity to discuss my Bill of Rights #ForStudentsAndParents. My legislation encourages a well-rounded education and positive relationships among parents, schools, and educators. [[url]]

Addressing the climate crisis requires us to cut emissions and move away from fossil fuels—a fact that industry lobbyists often deny. We cannot let Big Oil and other polluting industries interfere with our international climate efforts. [[url]]
